2012 Apple Mac Buyer’s Guide

There was a time when Apple just had one product  and that was the Apple Macintosh computer, but with the Mac now available in so many different flavors not to mention tablet computers like the Apple iPad and MP3 players such as the iPod – the selection can be a bit overwhelming for both the Brand New Apple computer user and professional alike.

2011 Apple Notebook Computers 

2011 Apple MacBook Pro 13 inch 2.4 GHz

2.4Ghz Intel Core i5 Processor, 4GB DDR3 RAM standard, 500GB hard drive with 8x superdrive and 13.3 inch LED display with 1280×800 resolution an Intel HD3000  Graphics. Ships standard with Mac OSX 10.7 Lion and offers a 7 hour battery life

Maximum Memory: 8GB MacBook Pro RAM

2011 Apple MacBook Pro 13 inch 2.8GHz

2.8Ghz Intel Dual Core  i7 Processor  with 4GB of DDR RAM all standard.  A bigger 750GB  hard drive and 8x Superdrive, 13.3 inch LED display with Intel HD3000 Graphics, Mac OSX Lion and 7 hour battery life.

Maximum Memory: 8GB MacBook Pro RAM

2011 Apple MacBook Pro 15 inch 2.2 GHz

2.2 Ghz Intel Quad Core Intel Core i7 Processor, 4GB DDR3 1333Mhz SDRAM with a 500GB 7400 RPM hard drive and an 8x superdrive ship standard. A 15.4 inch 1440×900 LED backlit display with AMD Radeon HD6750M with 512MB DDR5 RAM. Mac OS X Lion and 7 hour battery life.

Maximum Memory: 8GB MacBook Pro RAM

2011 Apple MacBook Pro 15  inch 2.4 GHz

2.4Ghz Quad Core Intel i7 processsor with 4GB of DDR3 SDRAM and a 750GB hard drive with 8x superdrive. 15.4 inch LED display features a 1440×900 native resolution with an AMD HD6770M with 1GB GDDR5 memory.

 Maximum Memory: 8GB MacBook Pro RAM

2011Apple MacBook Pro 17 inch 2.4Ghz

2.4Ghz Quad Core Intel i7 processor with 4GB DDR3 SDRA and a 750GB hard drive with an 8x Superdrive. 17 inch LED backlit display with 1920×1200 resolution and AMD Radeon HD6770M with 1GB GDDR5 graphics memory

Maximum Memory: 8GB MacBook Pro RAM

2011 Apple MacBook Air 11 inch 64GB

1.6 GHz Intel Core Dual Core i5 Processor with 2GB DDR3 SDRAM and 64GB solid state drive. 11.6 inch LED backlit display features an Intel HD 3000 Processor, Mac OS 10.7 Lion and 7 hour battery life.

Memory Upgrades not available for Apple MacBook Air models

 

2011 Apple MacBook Air 11 inch 128GB

1.6 GHz Intel Core Dual Core i5 Processor with 4GB of DDR3 RAM and a 128GB SSD drive. 11.6 LED display with Intel HD3000 graphics. Mac OS X 10.7 Lion and 7 hour battery life

Memory Upgrades not available for Apple MacBook Air models

2011 Apple MacBook Air 13 inch 128GB

1.7 Ghz Intel Core Dual Core i5 processsor with 4GB of DDR3 SDRAM and 128GB of SSD drive space. 13.3 inch LED display offers Intel HD 3000 Graphics and Mac OS X 10.7 with 7 hour battery life.

Memory Upgrades not available for Apple MacBook Air models

 

2011 Apple MacBook Air  13 inch 256GB

1.7Ghz Intel Dual Core i5 processor with 4GB of DDR3 SDRAM and a 256GB solid state hard drive. 13.3 inch LED display features Intel HD  3000 graphics processor and Mac OS X 10.7 Lion with  a 7 hour battery life

Memory Upgrades not available for Apple MacBook Air models

 

2011 Apple Desktop Computers  

2011 Apple Mac Mini 2.3GHz

Fast 2.3Ghz Intel Dual Core i5 processor with 3MB of shared L3 cache. 2GB of DDR3 Memory standard and a 500GB hard drive. Intel HD3000 Graphics processor and Mac OSX 10.7 Lion

Maximum Memory for Mac Mini: 8GB

2011 Apple Mac Mini 2.5Ghz 

Even faster 2.5Ghz Intel Dual Core i5 processor with more RAM (4GB vs 2GB), 500GB hard drive, and a faster AMD Radeon HD 6630M graphics processor with256mb of GDDR5 memory and Mac OSX 10.7 Lion

Maximum Memory for Mac Mini: 8GB

2011 Apple iMac 21.5 inch 2.5Ghz

Fast 2.5 GHz Quad Core  Intel Core i5 processor with 6mb of on chip L3 cache, a 500GB hard drive and 4GB of DDR3 SDRAM. Superdrive and a 21.5 inch LED backlit display with widescreen 16:9 viewing angle featuring a AMD HD 6750M video card

Maximum Memory for Apple iMac: 16GB

2011 Apple iMac 21.5 inch 2.7GHz

2.7 GHz Quad Core Intel Core i5 with 6MB of shared  L3 cache and a bigger 1TB hard drive as standard equipment, the same 21.5 inch LED display with 1920×1080 HD resolution thanks to the HD Radeon HD 6770M video card. Mac OSX 10.7 Lion  included as the operating system

Maximum Memory for Apple iMac: 16GB

2011 Apple iMac 27 inch 2.7GHz

2.7Ghz  Intel  Quad Core i5 processor  with 4GB DDR3 SDRAM and 1TB hard drive as standard and featuring a gorgeous 27 inch LED display and AMD Radeon Graphics processor with 512MB of GDDR5 memory and Mac OSX 10.7 Lion

Maximum Memory for Apple iMac: 16GB

2011 Apple iMac 27 inch 3.1Ghz 

The fastest Apple iMac offers a 3.1GHz Intel Quad Core  i5 processor, 4GB of DDR3 RAM and 1TB hard drive as standard along with a 27 inch LED display with 16:9 ratio  and Mac OSX 10.7 operating systems.

Maximum Memory for Apple iMac: 16GB

2011 Apple Mac Pro 2.8Ghz 

The cheapest Apple Mac Pro to come out of Apple is the 2.8 Ghz model that offers one 2.8Ghz  Intel Xeon Nehalem processor and 3GB of DDR3 ram as standard.  A big 1TB hard drive and an ATI Radeon video card  with HD 5770 video and 1GB GDDR5 video memory

Maximum Memory for Apple Mac Pro: 32GB

2011 Apple Mac Pro 2.4GHz

One would think that this Mac Pro would be slower than the cheap Mac Pro, but this is not the case. That’s because this particular Mac Pro offers two 2.4Ghz Quad Core Intel Westmere processors and  6GB of RAM out of the box making this the fastest Mac Pro and also the most expensive.  Besides speed, a 1TB hard drive and ATI Radeon HD5770 with 1GB GDDR5  make this the fastest desktop from Apple you can buy in 2012.

Maximum Memory for Apple Mac Pro: 32GB

Posted on Jan 30, 2011
